SUBSCRIPTION RATES

TRAC offers subscription rates for organizational users and private individuals

Ready to subscribe?

Subscriptions rates are tailored to the type and number of users. See Pricing Plans below.

For more information, contact a TRAC representative.

Single Users

Personal

As a courtesy to private researchers, TRAC offers a discounted rate to individuals who are subscribing from a personal email address and paying with a personal credit/debit card.

Buy

Multiple Users

Prorated

Multiple users within govermental/military, corporate, and media, as well as colleges and universities, receive pro-rated subscription discounts based on the number of users. TRAC fully supports academic institutions and provides subscriptions on a reduced rate based on FTE. For multiple users rates contact TRAC.

7-day trial for $125

TRAC is a subscription-based service. You can try TRAC for 7 days with this trial. If you choose to subscribe at the end of the trial, the trial cost will be deducted from the price of your subscription.

COVERING INCIDENTS IN REAL TIME, TRAC INCIDENT REPORTS AND TRAC INSIGHTS PROVIDE LIVE COVERAGE OF ONGOING EVENTS.

Profiles of 4,650 terrorist groups worldwide

5,000 archived videos of terrorist activities, many from terrorist groups themselves

Extensive cross-referenced content and triple-sort search functions for targeted results

Tens of thousands of archived and searchable news reports from international sources

Continuous update feed provides the best and most current content from unique and primary sources

Optional concierge service gives you exclusive access to terrorism and violence experts

A RESOURCE LIKE NO OTHER, ONLY TRAC DELIVERS:

  • The largest database of terrorist group profiles in the world
  • Five completely different types of content
  • Contributors from government and military, expert academia, trusted media, and sources on the ground in terrorism hot spots around the globe
  • The active recording and archiving of online activities by 3,500 of jihadists
  • Live, continuous updates to content across the site

"... The most value of this database, is that [it] fills gaps in understanding origins and development of a highly complex terrorism process in the certain world region. Properly used by national and international intelligence agencies , this database could help in struggle against terror in every part of world, more then ever before. As we all know, understanding is the key of security in modern age."

Aleksandar D.

"In today’s world, the hybrid threat between state and non-state actors increases risk across the spectrum of conflict from warfighting to humanitarian aid and reconstruction. Consequently, now more than ever it’s critical to understand the threat in your area so you can effectively protect your people, and those you want to help. TRAC is indispensable in understanding the range of threats, by providing key insights which enable safe and effective operations across the world’s conflict areas."

LTC Dan Mulcahy, US Army Retired and Director Security Strategies for Humanitarian Operations

"TRAC is what terrorism research resources should look like. I am proud to have contributed entries to this state-of-the-art database. ...TRAC is the model of how to make relevant information accessible. I very strongly recommend this product to all national security practitioners."

Sebastian G.
